intro: Penicillaria roxburghii, commonly known as the Himalayan penicillaria, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Penicillaria roxburghii is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of alpine ecosystems.
